newsitem.title: JAPAN: Hitachi Zosen sees 80 bln yen profit in 2005/06.
newsitem.headline: Hitachi Zosen sees 80 bln yen profit in 2005/06.

text.p: Hitachi Zosen Corp said on Wednesday it aims to achieve a parent current profit of 80 billion yen on sales of one trillion yen in the business year starting in April 2005.

In addition to this long-term forecast, the major shipbuilding and engineering company announced a mid-term target of a parent current profit of 36.6 billion yen on sales of 610 billion yen in 1999/2000.
The company left its October forecast of parent current profit for the current business year to March 31 unchanged at 30 billion yen on sales of 500 billion yen.

The firm said it planned to achieve the target mainly by increasing sales in non-shipbuilding business, such as of environmentally friendly power systems, garbage disposal systems, telecommunications equipment, and fittings for houses.
